description: Cladding remediations at Canadian Coast Guard Base, Victoria BC
full_summary:
# F1700-230554: Victoria Base Cladding Remediation Contract

## Tender Overview

This Invitation to Qualify seeks vendors interested in providing cladding, windows, lighting, and door remediation services at the Canadian Coast Guard Base in Victoria, British Columbia. The project aims to restore and upgrade critical systems and components at the base, primarily from the 1970s era.

## Details

*   Reference number: WS4340330506
*   Solicitation number: WS4340330506
*   Amendment number: 2
*   Tender closing date and deadline: 2024-01-26T14:00:00.
*   Expected contract start date: Not specified
*   Expected contract end date: 2025-03-31
*   Tender status: Expiré

## Request for Tender Description

The Canadian Department of Fisheries and Oceans, Canadian Coast Guard, issues tender solicitation for Building and facility maintenance and repair services, including Wall covering construction services Window and door installation and erection services Specialty building and trades services Industrial site rehabilitation.

## Vendor Selection and Evaluation

Bidders must complete a qualification process, and upon successful completion, they will be invited to provide a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings. The pre-qualification list that results from the first phase will expire and will not be used in any other solicitation. Following the second phase's solicitation closing, bid results will be recorded and may be obtained by e-mailing a request.

## Contact Information

19 requests are stated at contactInfo-addressLine

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans requirements will be contacted by Clara (SPAC/PSPC), who can be reached at  clara.dumay@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca 

Access more information for the tender on Ariba Discovery at [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18491505?extsite=MTg0OTE1MDVfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18491505?extsite=MTg0OTE1MDVfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==) (no further documents had been provided)
